Description: I'll be forever yours & you'll be forever mine; I'm the "Faithful Feline"! I'll be your shadow & your very best friend. I'll frolic at your feet & we can take naps in the sunshine. As your resident Velcro cat, I'm happiest just being by your side.
Name: TIBERIUS

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I’m extremely playful & affectionate with people & dogs! 
- I have loads of energy; I love to run & enjoy playing fetch.
- I already know cues to sit & lay down!

What I’m working on:

- Impulse control: I don’t know my own size or strength & tend to get a little carried away during playtime!
- Basic manners: I have some training under my belt already, but there is always room for improvement!

What I’m looking for:

- A very active household with experienced owners & no kids under 13 years of age. 
- Friendly, active canine companions who are similar to my own size & energy level to help keep me busy!
- A secure yard, with supervision outside. 
- Ample mental stimulation & lots of daily exercise!
- Ongoing positive reinforcement training to help with impulse control & general manners.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.*
Name: GUSTER

Description: From the shadows of the night a "Mystery Meow" will emerge to steal your heart! Most of us came here with no history, but some of us are just timid & our personalities have yet to shine. Give me a chance & I'll show you just how amazing I can be!
Name: SUMMERS

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I already know cues to sit, lay down & shake!
- I’m already crate trained!
- I’m extremely intelligent & very athletic! I love to run & enjoy playing fetch.

What I’m working on:

- Impulse control: I have a lot of energy & can get a bit carried away when I’m frustrated.
- Resource guarding: I tend to be a bit greedy when it comes to my food, bones & toys.

What I’m looking for:

- A very active household with herding dog experienced owners & no kids under 13 years of age. 
- A secure yard, with supervision outside. (I’ve been known to be a bit of a Houdini!)
- Canine companions who are similar to my own size & energy level.
- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise.
- Ongoing positive reinforcement training to help with impulse control & resource guarding.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.*
Name: KNOX

Description: Never fear! "Frisky Feline" is here! Leaping from the highest heights, pouncing from rooftops & saving my humans from the evil red dot! Being a hero is hard work, but someone has to do it! I need plenty of play time to be the best friend I can be!
Name: DIESEL

Description:
I am a transfer from another shelter & am ready to start my new life! 

Although my history is a mystery, I like the people & other dogs I have met here at HSU. It is unknown if I have been around cats or children before. I may or may not be fully house trained…some of us transfer animals have lived our entire lives in a loving home environment, while others have never lived indoors or been part of a family. I can tell you that we are all very eager to learn!

I may need some guidance & a healthy dose of patience while I'm learning the ropes. A regular daily routine, positive reinforcement, crate training & exercise will help me learn to be the very best canine companion I can be! If you do decide to take me home, the behavior staff at HSU is here to help me succeed, so feel free to contact them if you need help!

If you think we're a match, please call the foster department at The Humane Society of Utah to schedule a meet and greet.

My temporary home is:

In a Foster Home. Please contact the foster department at 801-261-2919 x215 for more information on Cashmere or to schedule a meet and greet appointment.
Name: CASHMERE

Description: Not to toot my own horn, but I'm a "Fancy Foster"! I needed some extra TLC when I arrived, so I went to foster care. The foster department knows the most about me & would love to tell you everything. Please ask the staff to "fetch" them for you!

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I’m extremely intelligent & very motivated to learn, especially when there are treats involved!
- I’m a perfect gentleman on a leash, as long as I’m walked using a no-pull harness.
- I already know cues to sit, down, wait & shake. (I’ll do anything for a treat & I love to learn!)

What I’m working on:

- Impulse control: I have a lot of energy & when I’m excited I sometimes forget how strong I am. 
- Basic manners: I still need training to learn some of the basics, like potty training & house manners.

What I’m looking for:

- A very active household with hound dog experienced owners & no kids under age 13. 
- Canine companions similar in size & energy level.
- Forgiving neighbors! (I’m a hound who loves the sound of my own voice.)
- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise are going to be a daily necessity for me.
- Ongoing positive reinforcement training for impulse control & basic manners.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.*

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Description:
Looking for a family dog? Look no further than Tripp! He is a fantastic big black lab who is housebroken, good with dogs of all sizes and temperaments, cats, and kids of all sizes. Tripp is a wonderful house dog-- quiet and well behaved, spends most of his daytime hours chilling on the couch or bed, or sitting at your heel. His go-to move is to walk along at your heel wherever you go and sit quietly at heel when you stop. 
While Tripp is a mellow housedog, he is an active guy outside. He loves to play in the snow and wrestle other dogs, bark at the neighbor dogs, or go for walks on or off-leash. Because Tripp has some separation anxiety, he needs to go to a home with another dog to keep him company.

Terrific Tripp is the whole package: handsome, affectionate, obedient, fun, and companionable. For more information about him or to meet him, contact the Foster Dept at 801-261-2919 x215. His adoption fee is $60 which includes this year's vaccinations (excluding rabies), deworming, neuter, microchip, a certificate for a free exam with a participating local veterinarian, and a slip leash to take him home.
Name: TRIPP

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I’m very playful, affectionate & well-mannered outside of the shelter environment.
- I’m great on a leash, as long as I’m walked using a no-pull harness.
- I already know cues to sit, wait & shake!

What I’m working on:

- Reactivity on leash & in kennel environment: Take me out for a walk & see what a different dog I become!
- Impulse control: Sometimes I get a little carried away during playtime!

What I’m looking for:

- An active household with experienced dog owners who will use a harness to walk me instead of a collar. 
- A family with older, sturdy children who won’t be overwhelmed by my enthusiastic play style. 
- A home with no cats or small animals. (I’m a little too interested in little critters, if you know what I mean.)
- A secure yard, with supervision outside. 
- Ample mental stimulation, exercise & ongoing positive reinforcement training for impulse control.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.*

Description:
Larue is a happy, lively and friendly spayed Min Pin blend. She is friendly with kids and adults; she is affectionate with family. She gets along with most dogs. 
Larue will need some exercise and mental stimulation. 
Larue was fostered to recover from her spay. Her foster family notice she is housetrained; she will sit by the door when she has to go. 
Larue is also a cuddle bug. 
She is not destructive and is not a barker.

Description: With ears like these I can’t help but over hear everyone say how adorable I am! Besides my adorably good looks I’ve got a soul that’s sure to melt your heart. Come to the Humane society today to verify my real, true, loving bunny heart & soul today!
Name: GEORGIA

Description:
I am a transfer from another shelter & am ready to start my new life! 

I am a "special needs adoption" because I have a conformational defect in my legs. I'm told I have crooked tibias & weak ligaments in both of my knees. I need to live a relatively mellow life with less activity than some dogs & will need low impact exercise. I may require further veterinary care in the future. My adopters should be aware that I may be more of a financial commitment than an animal without special needs.

Although my history is a mystery, I like the people & other dogs I have met here at HSU. It is unknown if I have been around cats or children before. I may or may not be fully house trained…some of us transfer animals have lived our entire lives in a loving home environment, while others have never lived indoors or been part of a family. I can tell you that we are all very eager to learn!

I may need some guidance & a healthy dose of patience while I'm learning the ropes. A regular daily routine, positive reinforcement, crate training & exercise will help me learn to be the very best canine companion I can be! If you do decide to take me home, the behavior staff at HSU is here to help me succeed, so feel free to contact them if you need help!

If you think we're a match, please bring your family (including other dogs) to The Humane Society of Utah to meet me today!

Description: From the shadows of the night a "Mystery Meow" will emerge to steal your heart! Most of us came here with no history, but some of us are just timid & our personalities have yet to shine. Give me a chance & I'll show you just how amazing I can be!
Name: CHRISSY

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I’m playful & affectionate with people once I’ve had a chance to warm up!
- I’m extremely intelligent & eager to learn!
- I’m well-mannered & walk great on a leash!

What I’m working on:

- Social skills with other dogs: I’m uncomfortable around other canines & prefer brief encounters with mellow dogs who respect my space.
- Basic manners: I have some training under my belt already, but there is always room for improvement!

What I’m looking for:

- An active household with experienced dog owners & no children under the age of 8. 
- A home where I can be the star of the show & won’t have to share the spotlight with another dog. 
- A home with no cats or other small animals. (I’m a little too interested in them, if you know what I mean.)
- A new stylist! (I will require regular professional grooming to keep me comfortable & healthy.)
- Ample mental stimulation, daily exercise & ongoing positive reinforcement training.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.* 
(If they are not available, you will need to make an appointment.)
Name: HURLEY

Description: Never fear! "Frisky Feline" is here! Leaping from the highest heights, pouncing from rooftops & saving my humans from the evil red dot! Being a hero is hard work, but someone has to do it! I need plenty of play time to be the best friend I can be!
Name: MARA

Description: "Couch Cat" is the name & relaxing is my game! When I'm not soaking up the sun or enjoying a snack, you'll find me cuddled up on the couch. I'll be happiest just relaxing with you & getting some love in between nap sessions!
Name: PUSS

Description: I'll be forever yours & you'll be forever mine; I'm the "Faithful Feline"! I'll be your shadow & your very best friend. I'll frolic at your feet & we can take naps in the sunshine. As your resident Velcro cat, I'm happiest just being by your side.
Name: NEO

Description: I’ve got a personality that is sure to melt your heart, sweet, petite, & handsome I’d make a great addition to any family! I’d love noting more than a human of my very own that will spoil me silly! Come meet me today!
Name: BLACK MAGIC

Description: I'm sure to brighten any ones day with my happy go lucky personality. I'd love nothing more than a family that can make sure to spend time with me every day, provide tons of treats & of course love too! Come meet me today!
Name: CHARLIE

Description: Fluffy & full of fun it's hard to believe I'm still up for adoption! I'd love a home that can provide proper housing, give me TONS of love & make sure they have enough time to spend with me daily! Call or come in today!
Name: HIP

Description: null
Name: BERNARD

Description:
The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!

What I have to offer:

- I’m extremely intelligent & very motivated to learn, especially when there are treats involved!
- I’m a semi-professional cuddle bug & enjoy getting attention from people of all ages!
- I already know cues to sit & lay down.

What I’m working on:

- Chewing: I love to chew so I’ll need lots of supervision & should be given appropriate toys & treats to work on.
- Separation Anxiety: I've been known to get pretty anxious when left alone for long periods of time... I'm what you might call a "velcro dog"! 
- Basic manners: I have some training under my belt already but there is always room for improvement!

What I’m looking for:

- Very active adopters with hound dog experience who won’t leave me alone for long hours every day. 
- Canine companions similar in size & energy level to keep me company.
- A very secure yard with supervision outside. (I’m a bit of a Houdini)
- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise are going to be a daily necessity for me.
- Ongoing positive reinforcement training for basic manners.

Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!

*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU’s Behavior Department.*
Name: MICKEY

Description:
I am a transfer from another shelter & am ready to start my new life! 

Although my history is a mystery, I like the people & other dogs I have met here at HSU. It is unknown if I have been around cats or children before. I may or may not be fully house trained…some of us transfer animals have lived our entire lives in a loving home environment, while others have never lived indoors or been part of a family. I can tell you that we are all very eager to learn!

I may need some guidance & a healthy dose of patience while I'm learning the ropes. A regular daily routine, positive reinforcement, crate training & exercise will help me learn to be the very best canine companion I can be! If you do decide to take me home, the behavior staff at HSU is here to help me succeed, so feel free to contact them if you need help!

If you think we're a match, please bring your family (including other dogs) to The Humane Society of Utah to meet me today!

My temporary home is:

THE HUMANE SOCIETY OF UTAH

4242 SOUTH 300 WEST 

MURRAY, UTAH 84107

 (801) 261-2919 x227

WWW.UTAHHUMANE.ORG
